newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Yields keep falling on Bulgaria's discount T-bills.
newsitem.headline: Yields keep falling on Bulgaria's discount T-bills.

text.p: Yields fell further at Thursday's auctions of Bulgaria's Finance Ministry one-week and four-week discount T-bills, central bank figures show.

The average yields to maturity on the two issues were 0.84 and 4.79 percent, down from 0.97 and 4.92 percent at Wednesday's auctions, 1.07 and 5.04 percent at Tuesday's auctions and 1.20 and 5.19 percent on Monday.
Bids were received for a total of 67.453 billion lev worth of T-bills as the one-week issue was oversubscribed two-fold and the four-week undersubscribed.
The ministry approved bids for a total of 51.513 billion levs of paper.
The issues were offered with par values of 12 billion levs and 45 billion levs, respectively and no minimum acceptable prices set in advance.
Details of the issues follow. Prices in percent of par:
Par value 12,000 million levs 45,000 million levs
Bids received 24,689.5 million levs 42,763.4 million levs
Bids approved 12,000 million levs 39,513.4 million levs
Avg yield to maturity 0.84 pct 4.79 pct
